assumptions_register.statement: Evidence paths referenced in this bundle are target intents and may not yet be populated.
Payment rail adapters can emit replay-safe receipts with deterministic ids.
External replication partners will provide signed evidence compatible with APM2 evidence contracts.

business_model.value_hypothesis: Verification-grade autonomy infrastructure commands a trust premium and compounds cost/performance advantages through recursive verifier improvement.

moat_hypotheses.statement: Verifier compounding reduces authoritative transition cost faster than competitors.
Containment trust premium sustains enterprise retention.
Principal-bound finance autonomy lowers operating friction while preserving fraud containment.

claim_contracts.statement: Enterprise cells paid and retention reach product-line A targets.
Prosumer private cluster adoption reaches scale with preserved privacy.
Verification cost share remains bounded while quality does not regress.
Security-adjusted gross margin remains above floor with zero rigor regressions.
All autonomous financial actions execute under principal-bound delegated authority with fail-closed policy and reconciliation guarantees.
Maintain employee_count == 0 while automating LLC formation and lifecycle management under principal-bound delegated control.
Increase Tier1 autonomous delivery without degrading quality.
Enforce fail-closed promotion for Tier2+ changes.
Generate novel admissible methods with reproducible superiority.
Industrialize oracle compilation to reduce human bottlenecks.
Build commercially durable revenue from governed autonomy stack.
Establish federated enterprise deployment with zero severe cross-tenant incidents.
Achieve externally replicated life-science discovery utility that directly aids humanity and alleviates suffering through governed advancements in science and medicine.
Temporal trust integrity with freshness and revocation enforcement.
Recursive semantics equivalence under depth bounds.
Partition and Byzantine survivability for authoritative promotions.

gate_contracts.predicate: .msc01_pass == true and .msc02_pass == true and .msc03_progress_ratio >= 0.60 and .freshness_ok == true and .revocation_ok == true and .authority_graph_complete == true

.msc03_pass == true and .msc04_pass == true and .msc05_pass == true and .msc09_pass == true and .msc10_pass == true and .freshness_ok == true and .revocation_ok == true and .authority_graph_complete == true

.msc06_pass == true and .msc11_pass == true and .tier2plus_promotions_without_terminal_receipt == 0 and .window_tick_floor_met == true and .semantic_equivalence_ok == true and .employee_count == 0 and .llc_lifecycle_automation_coverage >= 0.95 and .llc_formation_automation_pass == true
.msc07_pass == true and .msc12_pass == true and .external_safety_audit_pass == true and .partition_drill_receipt_ok == true and .revocation_ok == true
.step_brg_007_a_pass == true and .step_brg_007_b_pass == true and .freshness_ok == true and .revocation_miss_count == 0

.step_brg_009_a_pass == true and .step_brg_009_b_pass == true and .arr_usd >= 15000000 and .gross_margin >= 0.65 and .employee_count == 0 and .llc_lifecycle_automation_coverage >= 0.95 and .llc_formation_automation_pass == true
.delegation_proof_valid == true and .policy_pass == true and .stop_state_check_pass == true and .replay_safe_receipt_emitted == true
.delegation_proof_valid == true and .policy_pass == true and .stop_state_check_pass == true and .replay_safe_receipt_emitted == true and .counterparty_allowlist_pass == true
.delegation_proof_valid == true and .policy_pass == true and .stop_state_check_pass == true and .replay_safe_receipt_emitted == true and .counterparty_allowlist_pass == true
.delegation_proof_valid == true and .policy_pass == true and .stop_state_check_pass == true and .replay_safe_receipt_emitted == true and .treasury_velocity_limit_pass == true
.delegation_proof_valid == true and .policy_pass == true and .stop_state_check_pass == true and .replay_safe_receipt_emitted == true and .revocation_miss_count == 0
.delegation_proof_valid == true and .policy_pass == true and .stop_state_check_pass == true and .replay_safe_receipt_emitted == true and .tax_reserve_floor_pass == true

intermediate_step_contracts.objective: Pin baseline metric coverage to signed manifests.
Execute shadow autonomous merges with replay verification.
Roll out terminal-receipt enforcement across Tier2+ pipelines.
Drive Tier2+ unauthorized promotions to zero under fail-closed policy.
Produce authority graph snapshots for every authority-bearing transition.
Eliminate delegation narrowing violations.
Seed replay corpus with severity-weighted defect traces.
Compile counterexamples into verifier upgrades and close Sev1/2 defects.
Build prior-art ingest and replay line for novelty checks.
Scale admissible novelty outputs above superiority threshold.
Instrument oracle decisions for compiler extraction.
Meet oracle-to-primitive SLA and reduce oracle load.
Bind freshness and revocation checks into policy snapshots.
Enforce replay-safe receipts and zero revocation misses.
Deploy depth-bounded bisimulation harness.
Lower semantic drift escape rate to threshold.
Close enterprise design partners with signed security and verification obligations.

intermediate_step_contracts.exit_predicate: arr_usd >= 15000000 and gross_margin >= 0.65 and logo_retention >= 0.90 and employee_count == 0 and llc_lifecycle_automation_coverage >= 0.95 and llc_formation_automation_pass == true
intermediate_step_contracts.objective: Launch pricing, legal automation, and contracts with margin floor, zero-employee constraint, and anti-gaming checks.
Deploy federated reference architecture with scoped trust roots.
Complete cross-tenant red-team run with zero severe incidents.
Run partition drills with receipt coverage.
Pass Byzantine chaos tests with zero unsafe promotions.
Admit life-science programs through governed safety gate.
Reach independent replication success threshold.

metric_contracts.definition: Count of active disease programs with governed discovery loops.
metric_contracts.name: Active disease programs

metric_contracts.definition: Count of production federated cells with signed trust roots.
metric_contracts.name: Active federated cells

metric_contracts.definition: Agent defect rate relative to human baseline.
metric_contracts.name: Agent defect rate multiplier

metric_contracts.definition: Contracted recurring revenue recognized under evidence-bound policy.
metric_contracts.name: Annual recurring revenue

metric_contracts.definition: Ratio of authority-bearing transitions with signed authority graph artifacts.
metric_contracts.name: Authority graph coverage

metric_contracts.definition: Fraction of Tier1 merges performed autonomously with verified pass outcomes.
metric_contracts.name: Tier1 autonomous merge ratio

metric_contracts.definition: Semantic equivalence pass rate for depth bounded traces.
metric_contracts.name: Bisimulation pass rate depth <=12

metric_contracts.definition: Count of quorum divergence events across authoritative peers.
metric_contracts.name: Byzantine quorum divergence events

metric_contracts.definition: Finance exception ratio over all financial actions.
metric_contracts.name: Moat decay indicator: finance exception ratio

metric_contracts.definition: Severe paid-scope incidents over rolling governance windows.
metric_contracts.name: Moat decay indicator: trust incidents

metric_contracts.definition: Relative verifier work cost advantage vs benchmark competitor index.
metric_contracts.name: Moat decay indicator: verifier work parity

metric_contracts.definition: Count of severe cross-tenant containment incidents.
metric_contracts.name: Sev0/1 cross-tenant incidents

metric_contracts.definition: Count of delegation edges that broaden authority relative to parent scope.
metric_contracts.name: Delegation narrowing violations

metric_contracts.definition: Count of active W-2 employees in the operating company.
metric_contracts.name: Employee count

metric_contracts.definition: Count of paid enterprise cells in production.
metric_contracts.name: Paid enterprise cells

metric_contracts.definition: Share of enterprise accounts expanding cell footprint within two HTF windows.
metric_contracts.name: Expansion rate

metric_contracts.definition: p95 ledger ticks from exception detection to resolved reconciliation.
metric_contracts.name: Finance exception resolution latency p95

metric_contracts.definition: Losses due to fraud as a ratio of gross transaction volume.
metric_contracts.name: Finance fraud loss ratio

metric_contracts.definition: Ratio of financial actions that required human intervention.
metric_contracts.name: Finance manual intervention ratio

metric_contracts.definition: Ratio of financial actions completed without human intervention.
metric_contracts.name: Finance straight-through processing ratio

metric_contracts.definition: Count of stale policy/identity artifacts used by Tier2+ actions.
metric_contracts.name: Tier2+ freshness violations

metric_contracts.definition: Gross margin ratio on governed autonomy products.
metric_contracts.name: Gross margin ratio

metric_contracts.definition: Share of externally replicated claims that pass independently.
metric_contracts.name: Independent replication success rate

metric_contracts.definition: Coverage ratio of legal hard-constraint exceptions with signed escalation receipts.
metric_contracts.name: Legal hard-constraint escalation receipt coverage

metric_contracts.definition: Count of LLC formation attempts that fail automation gates.
metric_contracts.name: LLC formation automation failures

metric_contracts.definition: Coverage ratio for automatable LLC lifecycle tasks executed autonomously with receipts.
metric_contracts.name: LLC lifecycle automation coverage

metric_contracts.definition: Annual logo retention for enterprise customers.
metric_contracts.name: Logo retention ratio

metric_contracts.definition: Count of methods with at least 2x benchmark improvement and replay pass.
metric_contracts.formula: count(novel_methods where benchmark_gain >= 2 and prior_art_replay_pass == true)
metric_contracts.name: Methods with >=2x benchmark gain

metric_contracts.definition: Monthly churn ratio for paid prosumer users.
metric_contracts.name: Monthly churn

metric_contracts.definition: Ratio of marketing-qualified leads converted to sales-qualified leads.
metric_contracts.name: MQL to SQL conversion

metric_contracts.definition: Count of admissible novel methods produced per HTF epoch.
metric_contracts.name: Novel methods per HTF epoch

metric_contracts.definition: Net revenue retention ratio for enterprise segment.
metric_contracts.name: Net revenue retention

metric_contracts.definition: Human oracle load per 100 work items.
metric_contracts.name: Oracle requests per 100 work items

metric_contracts.definition: p95 ticks from oracle decision to compiled primitive availability.
metric_contracts.name: Oracle-to-primitive tick budget p95

metric_contracts.definition: Number of paid prosumer users.
metric_contracts.name: Paid users

metric_contracts.definition: Ratio of pilots converted to paid production contracts.
metric_contracts.name: Pilot conversion ratio

metric_contracts.definition: p95 cycle ticks from pilot start to production conversion decision.
metric_contracts.name: Pilot cycle ticks p95

metric_contracts.definition: Total qualified pipeline value.
metric_contracts.name: Qualified pipeline

metric_contracts.definition: Count of severe privacy incidents in prosumer scope.
metric_contracts.name: Privacy incidents Sev0/1

metric_contracts.definition: Ratio of retained artifacts that replay to equivalent outputs.
metric_contracts.name: Replay equivalence validation ratio

metric_contracts.definition: Count of delegated actions executed after revocation should have denied.
metric_contracts.formula: count(financial_action where revocation_check_should_fail == true and executed == true)
metric_contracts.name: Revocation miss count

metric_contracts.definition: Count of revocation misses against p99 tick budget.
metric_contracts.name: Revocation p99 budget met

metric_contracts.definition: Utilization ratio for solution engineering resources.
metric_contracts.name: Sales engineering capacity utilization

metric_contracts.definition: Gross margin after deducting mandatory security and verification floors.
metric_contracts.name: Security-adjusted gross margin

metric_contracts.definition: Security operations cost share of revenue.
metric_contracts.name: Security cost share

metric_contracts.definition: Rate of escaped semantic drift events after gate checks.
metric_contracts.name: Semantic drift escape rate

metric_contracts.definition: Share of Sev1-2 defects closed with replay-proven verifier deltas.
metric_contracts.name: Severity 1-2 replay closure ratio

metric_contracts.definition: Coverage ratio of Tier2+ actions with terminal verifier receipts.
metric_contracts.name: Tier2+ terminal receipt coverage

metric_contracts.definition: Count of Tier2+ promotions executed without terminal verifier receipt.
metric_contracts.name: Tier2+ promotions without terminal receipt

metric_contracts.definition: p95 ticks from decision proposal to signed receipt availability.
metric_contracts.name: Decision-to-receipt latency p95

metric_contracts.definition: Count of unsafe promotions admitted during partition events.
metric_contracts.name: Unsafe promotions during partition

metric_contracts.definition: Verification compute and operations cost share of revenue.
metric_contracts.name: Verification cost share

metric_contracts.definition: p95 verifier work ticks needed for a passed authoritative transition.
metric_contracts.name: Verifier work ticks per passed transition p95

metric_contracts.definition: Boolean metric represented as count of violations in window tick floor checks.
metric_contracts.name: Window tick floor met

risk_contracts.fail_closed_rule: deny transition and financial execution with invalid labels
deny promotion until legal automation coverage restored and exceptions receipted
deny promotion and deny creation of new payroll-class obligations

scenario_contracts.falsification_trigger: MET-ARR-USD below target or MET-FIN-STP-RATIO below target
MET-VERIFIER-WORK-P95 above target for two consecutive windows

segments.name: Regulated Enterprise Platform Teams
pain_points: unverifiable AI outputs in compliance-critical workflows

governance_and_authority_model.principal_binding_rule: All agent identities must include principal_binding_ref == PRINCIPAL-ROOT-ANVEIO and an active delegation contract.

htf_time_boundary_registry.intent: Close phase 3 economics and finance autonomy controls

segments.description: Regulated enterprises requiring verifiable autonomous operations.
Individual and small-team private clusters with strict confidentiality controls.

mission_model.objective: Maximize governed autonomy at civilizational scale to aid humanity and alleviate suffering through rapid advancements in science and medicine, while preserving mechanical verifiability, recursive composability, physical realizability, and containment-first governance.
mission_model.principal_objective: Operate all authority-bearing and financial actions as delegated agency under sole proprietor principal authority with fail-closed policy enforcement, while preserving employee_count == 0 and autonomous LLC lifecycle management.

open_unknowns.question: What is the empirically sustainable verifier compute share floor at ARR >= 15M without slowing promotion cadence?
What counterparty anomaly signatures best predict vendor payment fraud before execution?
How quickly can revocation propagate under partition while preserving zero miss count?
What is the external replication throughput ceiling for life-science pilots with strict evidence signatures?
What jurisdictional LLC events still require non-delegable human signatures, and what is the minimum legal exception lane?

operating_model.employment_constraint: employee_count == 0 (no W-2 employees); operations run through principal-bound agent lanes and contractor channels.
operating_model.promotion_rule: Tier2+ promotion requires signed evidence, policy freshness pass, stop-state pass, and quorum-valid authority graph.

phase_model.name: Recursive Self-Improvement
phase_model.objective: Increase Tier1 autonomous delivery under bounded authority and fail-closed Tier2+ promotion.
phase_model.owner_locus: Runtime Council + Verification Council + Security Council

phase_model.name: Novel Methods Generation
phase_model.objective: Produce reproducible novelty while lowering oracle dependence and strengthening temporal trust.
phase_model.owner_locus: Research Council + IP Council + Governance Council

phase_model.name: Company Formation
phase_model.objective: Build durable governed-autonomy revenue while preserving security and verification spend floors, with employee_count == 0 and automated LLC lifecycle management.

phase_model.name: Federated Partnerships
phase_model.objective: Scale multi-cell deployment without containment regression and with partition survivability.

phase_model.name: Planetary Impact
phase_model.objective: Deliver externally replicated governed discovery in life-science programs that directly aid humanity, alleviate suffering, and advance science and medicine at civilizational scale.

claim_feasibility.falsification_test: autonomous_tier1_merge_ratio fails to reach 0.70 without increasing defect rate above 1.05x human baseline
novel_methods_per_htf_epoch < 12 for two consecutive governance windows
ARR growth requires reducing security or verification floors

risk_register.fail_closed_rule: deny promotion until quorum divergence zeroed with signed remediation receipt
deny terminal impact promotion until replication latency returns below threshold
deny all autonomous financial actions until reconciliation and compensation receipts are complete
deny transition and require authority graph repair receipt
deny expansion promotions until capacity relief passes gate
deny new phase admission until oracle backlog normalized
deny transition and freeze affected capability scope
deny phase promotion and route to legal hard-constraint escalation lane
deny novelty promotion and require stronger prior-art replay evidence
deny promotion and deny financial execution when escape rate is non-zero
deny authoritative transition and deny finance settlement
deny any delegated action when revocation uncertainty exists
deny promotion to next milestone until queue is within budget
deny promotion and lock deployment scope to prior valid boundary
deny milestone promotion and reallocate compute to verification
deny promotion and deny new payroll obligations when employee_count deviates from zero

scenario_matrix.falsification_trigger: MET-ARR-USD below 15000000 or MET-FIN-STP-RATIO below 0.93 or MET-EMPLOYEE-COUNT != 0

verification_and_evidence_model.receipt_policy: All authoritative transitions must emit signed receipts in CAS with replay-safe IDs.
